trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs for Xamarin iOS apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs for Xamarin iOS apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Xamarin iOS application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Xamarin iOS application.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to an iOS application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to an iOS application.

trans-unit.source: You'll create a blank Xamarin.iOS app that receives push notifications by using the Apple Push Notification Service (APNs).
trans-unit.target: You'll create a blank Xamarin.iOS app that receives push notifications by using the Apple Push Notification Service (APNs).

trans-unit.source: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.
trans-unit.target: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.

trans-unit.source: The finished code is available in the <link><linkText>NotificationHubs app[github]</linkText><title></title></link> sample.
trans-unit.target: The finished code is available in the <link><linkText>NotificationHubs app[github]</linkText><title></title></link> sample.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Xcode 6.0[install xcode]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Xcode 6.0[install xcode]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: An iOS 7.0 (or later version) capable device
trans-unit.target: An iOS 7.0 (or later version) capable device

trans-unit.source: iOS Developer Program membership
trans-unit.target: iOS Developer Program membership

trans-unit.source: [Xamarin.iOS]
trans-unit.target: [Xamarin.iOS]

trans-unit.source: [Azure Mobile Services Component]
trans-unit.target: [Azure Mobile Services Component]

trans-unit.source: Because of configuration requirements for push notifications, you must deploy and test push notifications on an iOS capable device (iPhone or iPad) instead of in the simulator.
trans-unit.target: Because of configuration requirements for push notifications, you must deploy and test push notifications on an iOS capable device (iPhone or iPad) instead of in the simulator.

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Xamarin.iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Xamarin.iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The Apple Push Notification Service uses certificates to authenticate your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: The Apple Push Notification Service uses certificates to authenticate your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Follow these instructions to create the necessary certificates and upload them to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Follow these instructions to create the necessary certificates and upload them to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: For the official APNs feature documentation, see [Apple Push Notification Service].
trans-unit.target: For the official APNs feature documentation, see [Apple Push Notification Service].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Generate the Certificate Signing Request file
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Generate the Certificate Signing Request file

trans-unit.source: First you must generate the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file, which is used by Apple to generate a signed certificate.
trans-unit.target: First you must generate the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) file, which is used by Apple to generate a signed certificate.

trans-unit.source: From the Utilities folder, run the Keychain Access tool.
trans-unit.target: From the Utilities folder, run the Keychain Access tool.

trans-unit.source: Click Keychain Access, expand Certificate Assistant, and then click Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority.
trans-unit.target: Click Keychain Access, expand Certificate Assistant, and then click Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority.

trans-unit.source: Select your User Email Address, type Common Name and CA Email Address values, make sure that Saved to disk is selected, and then click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Select your User Email Address, type Common Name and CA Email Address values, make sure that Saved to disk is selected, and then click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for the CSR file in Save As, select the location in Where, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for the CSR file in Save As, select the location in Where, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: This saves the CSR file in the selected location.
trans-unit.target: This saves the CSR file in the selected location.

trans-unit.source: The default location is on the desktop.
trans-unit.target: The default location is on the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Remember the location that you have chosen for this file.
trans-unit.target: Remember the location that you have chosen for this file.

trans-unit.source: Next, register your app with Apple, enable push notifications, and upload this exported CSR to create a push certificate.
trans-unit.target: Next, register your app with Apple, enable push notifications, and upload this exported CSR to create a push certificate.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for push notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for push notifications

trans-unit.source: To be able to send push notifications to an iOS app from Mobile Services, you must register your application with Apple and also register for push notifications.
trans-unit.target: To be able to send push notifications to an iOS app from Mobile Services, you must register your application with Apple and also register for push notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the iOS Provisioning Portal at the Apple Developer Center, sign in with your Apple ID, click Identifiers, click App IDs, and finally click the + sign to register a new app.
trans-unit.target: If you have not already registered your app, navigate to the iOS Provisioning Portal at the Apple Developer Center, sign in with your Apple ID, click Identifiers, click App IDs, and finally click the + sign to register a new app.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your app in Description and a value for Bundle Identifier, check the Push Notifications option in the App Services section, and then click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your app in Description and a value for Bundle Identifier, check the Push Notifications option in the App Services section, and then click Continue.

trans-unit.source: This generates your app ID and requests that you submit the information.
trans-unit.target: This generates your app ID and requests that you submit the information.

trans-unit.source: Click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit.

trans-unit.source: Once you click Submit, you will see the Registration complete screen, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Once you click Submit, you will see the Registration complete screen, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Click Done.
trans-unit.target: Click Done.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to supply a Bundle Identifier value other than MobileServices.Quickstart, you must also update the bundle identifier value in your Xcode project.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to supply a Bundle Identifier value other than MobileServices.Quickstart, you must also update the bundle identifier value in your Xcode project.

trans-unit.source: Locate the app ID that you just created, and click its row.
trans-unit.target: Locate the app ID that you just created, and click its row.

trans-unit.source: Clicking the app ID will display details about the app and the app ID:
trans-unit.target: Clicking the app ID will display details about the app and the app ID:

trans-unit.source: Click Edit, and then scroll to the bottom of the screen and click Create Certificate... under the section Development Push SSL Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Edit, and then scroll to the bottom of the screen and click Create Certificate... under the section Development Push SSL Certificate.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Add iOS Certificate assistant.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Add iOS Certificate assistant.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses a development certificate.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses a development certificate.

trans-unit.source: The same process is used for registering a production certificate.
trans-unit.target: The same process is used for registering a production certificate.

trans-unit.source: Just make sure that you set the same certificate type when you upload the certificate to Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Just make sure that you set the same certificate type when you upload the certificate to Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Click Choose File, browse to the location in which you saved the CSR file that you created in the first task, and then click Generate.
trans-unit.target: Click Choose File, browse to the location in which you saved the CSR file that you created in the first task, and then click Generate.

trans-unit.source: After the certificate is created by the portal, click Download, and then click Done.
trans-unit.target: After the certificate is created by the portal, click Download, and then click Done.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the signing certificate and saves it to your computer in your Downloads folder.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the signing certificate and saves it to your computer in your Downloads folder.

trans-unit.source: By default, the downloaded file for a development certificate is named aps_development.cer.
trans-unit.target: By default, the downloaded file for a development certificate is named aps_development.cer.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the downloaded push certificate aps_development.cer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the downloaded push certificate aps_development.cer.

trans-unit.source: This installs the new certificate in the Keychain, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: This installs the new certificate in the Keychain, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: The name in your certificate might be different, but it will be prefixed with <html></html>Apple Development iOS Push Notification Services:<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: The name in your certificate might be different, but it will be prefixed with <html></html>Apple Development iOS Push Notification Services:<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Later, you will use this certificate to generate a .p12 file and upload it to your notification hub to enable push notifications through APNs.
trans-unit.target: Later, you will use this certificate to generate a .p12 file and upload it to your notification hub to enable push notifications through APNs.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a provisioning profile for the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a provisioning profile for the app

trans-unit.source: Back in the iOS Provisioning Portal, select Provisioning Profiles, select All, and then click the + button to create a new profile.
trans-unit.target: Back in the iOS Provisioning Portal, select Provisioning Profiles, select All, and then click the + button to create a new profile.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Add iOS Provisioning Profile wizard.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Add iOS Provisioning Profile wizard.

trans-unit.source: Select iOS App Development under Development as the provisioning profile type, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Select iOS App Development under Development as the provisioning profile type, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Select the app ID for the Mobile Services Quickstart app from the App ID drop-down list, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Select the app ID for the Mobile Services Quickstart app from the App ID drop-down list, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: In the Select certificates screen, select the certificate that you created earlier, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: In the Select certificates screen, select the certificate that you created earlier, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Select the devices to use for testing, and click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Select the devices to use for testing, and click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Finally, choose a name for the profile in Profile Name, click Generate, and click Done.
trans-unit.target: Finally, choose a name for the profile in Profile Name, click Generate, and click Done.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: In Xcode, open the Organizer, select the Devices view, select Provisioning Profiles in the Library section in the left pane, and import the provisioning profile that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In Xcode, open the Organizer, select the Devices view, select Provisioning Profiles in the Library section in the left pane, and import the provisioning profile that you just created.

trans-unit.source: On the left, select your device, and again import the provisioning profile.
trans-unit.target: On the left, select your device, and again import the provisioning profile.

trans-unit.source: In Keychain Access, right-click the new certificate, click Export, type a name for your certificate, select the .p12 format, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In Keychain Access, right-click the new certificate, click Export, type a name for your certificate, select the .p12 format, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the file name and location of the exported certificate.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the file name and location of the exported certificate.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that the Xcode project uses the new profile for code signing.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that the Xcode project uses the new profile for code signing.

trans-unit.source: Next, you must upload the certificate to your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Next, you must upload the certificate to your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure your notification hub
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure your notification hub

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click App Services, click Service Bus, click Notification Hub, and then click Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click App Services, click Service Bus, click Notification Hub, and then click Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a New Notification Hub.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your notification hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a New Notification Hub.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace that you just created (usually *notification hub name*-ns), and then click the Configure tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace that you just created (usually *notification hub name*-ns), and then click the Configure tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click the Notification Hubs tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the Notification Hubs tab at the top, and then click the notification hub that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Select the Configure tab at the top, and then click Upload for the Apple notification settings.
trans-unit.target: Select the Configure tab at the top, and then click Upload for the Apple notification settings.

trans-unit.source: Then select the .p12 certificate that you exported earlier, along with the password for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Then select the .p12 certificate that you exported earlier, along with the password for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to select whether you want to use the Production (if you want to send push notifications to users who purchased your app from the store) or the Sandbox (during development) push service.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to select whether you want to use the Production (if you want to send push notifications to users who purchased your app from the store) or the Sandbox (during development) push service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click Connection Information.
trans-unit.target: Click the Dashboard tab at the top, and then click Connection Information.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the two connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the two connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Your notification hub is now configured to work with APNs, and you have the connection strings to register your app and send notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your notification hub is now configured to work with APNs, and you have the connection strings to register your app and send notifications.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connect your app to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connect your app to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: Create a new project
trans-unit.target: Create a new project

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio, create a new iOS project and select the Unified API > Single View Application template.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio, create a new iOS project and select the Unified API > Single View Application template.

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to the Azure Messaging component.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to the Azure Messaging component.

trans-unit.source: In the Solution view, right-click the Components folder for your project and choose Get More Components.
trans-unit.target: In the Solution view, right-click the Components folder for your project and choose Get More Components.

trans-unit.source: Search for the Azure Messaging component and add the component to your project.
trans-unit.target: Search for the Azure Messaging component and add the component to your project.

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.cs, add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.cs, add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: using WindowsAzure.Messaging;
trans-unit.target: using WindowsAzure.Messaging;

trans-unit.source: Declare an instance of SBNotificationHub:
trans-unit.target: Declare an instance of SBNotificationHub:

trans-unit.source: Create a Constants.cs class with the following variables:
trans-unit.target: Create a Constants.cs class with the following variables:

trans-unit.source: In AppDelegate.cs, update FinishedLaunching() to match the following:
trans-unit.target: In AppDelegate.cs, update FinishedLaunching() to match the following:

trans-unit.source: Override the RegisteredForRemoteNotifications() method in AppDelegate.cs:
trans-unit.target: Override the RegisteredForRemoteNotifications() method in AppDelegate.cs:

trans-unit.source: Override the ReceivedRemoteNotification() method in AppDelegate.cs:
trans-unit.target: Override the ReceivedRemoteNotification() method in AppDelegate.cs:

trans-unit.source: Create the following ProcessNotification() method in AppDelegate.cs:
trans-unit.target: Create the following ProcessNotification() method in AppDelegate.cs:

trans-unit.source: You can choose to override FailedToRegisterForRemoteNotifications() to handle situations such as no network connection.
trans-unit.target: You can choose to override FailedToRegisterForRemoteNotifications() to handle situations such as no network connection.

trans-unit.source: Run the app on your device.
trans-unit.target: Run the app on your device.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Send notifications from your backend
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Send notifications from your backend

trans-unit.source: You can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via our <html></html>REST interface<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: You can send notifications by using Notification Hubs from any backend via our <html></html>REST interface<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will send notifications by using a .NET console app and by using a mobile service through a node script.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will send notifications by using a .NET console app and by using a mobile service through a node script.

trans-unit.source: To send notifications by using a .NET app:
trans-unit.target: To send notifications by using a .NET app:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Visual C# console application:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Visual C# console application:

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK by using the <html></html>WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK by using the <html></html>WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio main menu, click Tools, click Library Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio main menu, click Tools, click Library Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the console window, type the following and press Enter:
trans-unit.target: Then, in the console window, type the following and press Enter:

trans-unit.source: Open the Program.cs file and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the Program.cs file and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: In your Program class, add the following method:
trans-unit.target: In your Program class, add the following method:

trans-unit.source: Add the following lines in your Main method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following lines in your Main method:

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: You should receive an alert on your device.
trans-unit.target: You should receive an alert on your device.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Wi-Fi, make sure that your connection is working.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Wi-Fi, make sure that your connection is working.

trans-unit.source: You can find all the possible payloads in the Apple [Local and Push Notification Programming Guide].
trans-unit.target: You can find all the possible payloads in the Apple [Local and Push Notification Programming Guide].

trans-unit.source: To send a notification by using a mobile service, follow [Get started with Mobile Services], and then:
trans-unit.target: To send a notification by using a mobile service, follow [Get started with Mobile Services], and then:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and select your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and select your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Select the Scheduler tab on the top.
trans-unit.target: Select the Scheduler tab on the top.

trans-unit.source: Create a new scheduled job, insert a name, and select On demand.
trans-unit.target: Create a new scheduled job, insert a name, and select On demand.

trans-unit.source: When the job is created, click the job name.
trans-unit.target: When the job is created, click the job name.

trans-unit.source: Then click the Script tab on the top bar.
trans-unit.target: Then click the Script tab on the top bar.

trans-unit.source: Insert the following script inside your scheduler function.
trans-unit.target: Insert the following script inside your scheduler function.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace the placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace the placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click Run Once on the bottom bar.
trans-unit.target: Click Run Once on the bottom bar.

trans-unit.source: You should receive an alert on your device.
trans-unit.target: You should receive an alert on your device.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your iOS devices.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your iOS devices.

trans-unit.source: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance] and in the [Notification Hubs How-To for iOS].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance] and in the [Notification Hubs How-To for iOS].
